question: How do I know if Allah is displeased with me?
answer:
QUESTION
Assalamo Alaikum. Dear respected Imam I have made mistakes in the past. I am regretful for the sins I have commited. I try endlessly to become a better muslim but as you know we can always be better. My situation is that I have been hurt deeply. After so many years why do I still feel this pain as strong as I did then. I have attempted to correct all that I have done wrong to people and I don't know what much I can do except make dua for us all. I want you to know that I wish good for all. Do I feel this pain as a result of Allah being displeased with me and that is my worry? If Allah is not displeased with me then I have no problem. How can I know if I am displeasing Allah?

However, Allah says, 'Verily Allah will not forgive a person%0D%0Awho ascribe partners (commit Shirk) with Him.' The only sin that is%0D%0Aunforgivable is Kufr (disbelief) and Shirk (ascribing partners).
